reviews.review_msg: Dr. Chen is a boss. Literally just finished up my degree, but was missing physics 221. Was taking two courses while working full time, so I didn't study too much. still got a c-. Granted, if I had actually spent the time to study you'll get a good grade (the topic is difficult). All in all, super swell guy.

Pretty good prof. Lecture is not super clear but read the textbook then still fine. His is pretty funny, good story telling in class. Exams are easy if you did sample exams + there are easy bonus quiz, same question from midterm just asking you to do them again.
One of the best profs I ever had. He is extremely helpful, fair exams and midterms. I love this guy.

He's a great guy! Exams are really fair.. and are very much coordinated with the homework assignments. Make sure you understand the HWs though, because he won't post the solutions to them. But if you do the assignments or get solns from somewhere he sometimes put the exact questions on final from HW. 50% of our final was from HWs.. I got a B :D

He's a nice guy but I don't think his teaching style is the best for conveying concepts in physics. Way too much time spent on listing off derivations rather then making an effort to explain concepts. Visit MIT Open Courseware website for an excelent resource for this class ... MIT education for free!!
Hard teacher!  I am a practicing engineer and I remember his classes to be the hardest of my whole degree (I was an A- student but really struggled in his class)
Good sense of humour; his poems are hilarious. Tests are absolute killer. Make sure you take very good notes.
Wonderful person!  Teaches VERY quickly on transparencies. Quite strict. Killer exams.
